newsitem.title: USA: ConSyGen to carry out Year 2000 projects.
newsitem.headline: ConSyGen to carry out Year 2000 projects.

text.p: ConSyGen Inc on Friday said it agreed to carry out two Year 2000 conversion projects for an unnamed Fortune 50 company.
ConSyGen said it was not charging the client for the projects, but it expected the work to lead to "revenue producing contracts" with the company in the future.
A spokesman said it would release the client's name when the project was completed in about 3 weeks.
ConSyGen said the client uses two different IBM mainframe systems. There are about 575,000 lines of code involved in both projects.
ConSyGen said it could now offer Year 2000 conversions on Bull, Hewlett-Packard, Unisys and IBM platforms.

Such conversion projects involve adapting older computers and software programs to allow them to process two-digit dates correctly after December 31, 1999. When the year 2000 changes, older systems may misinterpret the "00" date field as the year "1900," presenting the risk of a crash or loss of data.
